The number of firefighters and other personnel battling the Lilac Fire reached a peak of 1,409 Sunday and officials at the central command center say they're likely to begin releasing crews from duty . Firefighters continue to gain ground on the #LilacFire. This morning's numbers from @CALFIRESANDIEGO show it's 80 percent contained.

Some firefighters are expected to be released Sunday from the Lilac Fire but will be assigned to fight other blazes ravaging Southern California. Southern California firestorms have brought bad air, health problems that are expected to linger. factText: Six wildfires have destroyed homes and caused the closure of one of America’s busiest freeways around Los Angeles while forcing nearly 200,000 people from their homes. L.A. Is Burning: 200,000 People Flee Record Fire Disaster can strike everywhere — even in some of America’s richest and most exclusive neighborhoods. More than 230,000 people have been forced to flee their homes across Southern California this week, as December's shockingly dry, hot and windy conditions brought on fire danger.
